text: If I worried what every bitch in New York was saying about me, I'd never leave the house.
author: Samantha Jones

text: I love you, but I love me more.
author: Samantha Jones

text: If you want crappy things to stop happening to you, then stop accepting crap and demand something more.
author: Cristina Yang

text: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another stepping stone to greatness.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: I'm not going to limit myself just because people won't accept the fact that I can do something else.
author: Dolly Parton

text: My mother told me to be a lady. And for her, that meant be your own person, be independent.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

text: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make
author: Jane Goodall

text: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
author: Maya Angelou

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

text: You may shoot me with your words… But still, like air, I'll rise.
author: Maya Angelou

text: And it's hard to dance with a devil on your back, so shake him off.
author: Florence + The Machine

text: I'm not the hero in my story, I'm just learning from the pain.
author: Ethel Cain

text: Thunder only happens when it's raining. Players only love you when they're playing.
author: Fleetwood Mac

text: She wasn't looking for a knight. She was looking for a sword.
author: Atticus

text: I'm a woman with thoughts and questions and shit to say.
author: Lady Bird

text: I never promised to be sweet, I only promised to be wild.
author: Clarissa Pinkola Estés

text: You can't keep dancing with ghosts and expect to feel alive.
author: Ethel Cain

text: I am not fragile like a flower; I am fragile like a bomb.
author: Frida Kahlo

text: She was both hellfire and holy water. And the flavor you tasted depended on how you treated her.
author: Sneha Pal

text: The most dangerous thing a woman can do is be herself.
author: Simone de Beauvoir
